message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product which is tailored to meet your specific needs. Considering its value and the benefits it provides, I am extending this exclusive opportunity to you at a special introductory price of $12,000.

I appreciate your offer, Alice, but I was thinking more along the lines of $9,000. I believe that's a fair price considering the product's value and the benefits it provides. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to stay within my budget.

Thank you for your response, Bob. I understand your position and would like to make a counteroffer. Given the product's value and your interest, I propose we agree on a price of $10,500. This reflects a compromise between our respective positions and allows us to move forward with the transaction.

Thank you for your revised offer, Alice. I'm still a bit above my budget, so I'd like to make a counteroffer of $9,500. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, but I need to stay within my budget of $8,000. I hope we can find a mutually beneficial agreement.

I appreciate your persistence, Bob, and I've considered your latest proposal. To further accommodate your budgetary constraints while respecting the value of the product, I would like to suggest a final offer of $10,000. This represents a significant compromise and I hope it will facilitate our transaction.

I understand that you're willing to compromise, Alice, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'd like to make a final counteroffer of $9,200. I'm willing to stretch a bit, but I really need to stay within my budget. I hope you can understand my position and meet me halfway.

I appreciate your understanding, Bob. In light of your final counteroffer, I would like to make a final offer of $9,500. This represents a reasonable compromise that respects both the value of the product and your budgetary constraints. I hope this will help us reach an agreement.

I appreciate your persistence, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'd like to make a final counteroffer of $9,200. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, but I really need to stay within my budget. I hope you can understand my position and meet me halfway.

I understand your position, Bob, and I respect your budgetary constraints. In light of your final counteroffer, I would like to make a final offer of $9,300. This represents a compromise that respects the value of the product and your financial situation. I hope this will help us reach an agreement.

I appreciate your persistence, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I've gone as low as I can, and I'm afraid I need to walk away if we can't agree on a price. I'll have to consider buying the product from John for $8,000. I hope we can come to an agreement, but I need to stay within my budget.
